page.title: 18ANIMAL SHELTER _ BALLYTOBER
page.content: {The animal shelter}on Ballytober Rd., used to be a cottage, but has been {owned by USPCA}for 13 years.{Dogs and {cats}are cared for in cages, and{goats {birds ,ponies, donkeys and rabbits}are also looked after.The shelter has room for up to 30 pets, though just 15 are here today. {The inspector}has worked here for 10 years,having{trained at the society's {Carryduff HQ.}Her day begins at 8.30 when she{feeds the animals}and cleans out the cages. She releases them into the compound ,before going out in her {USPCA van to collect unwanted pets}and to{investigate complaints of cruelty. Serious cases of ill_treatment are given to the police.The last such case was 3 years ago.Fighting neighbours sometimes report falsely on each other At 3pm the{pets are cleaned and fed. The inspector's{area covers N.Antrim.
